intro: Rosa × polliniana var. variegata, commonly known as the variegated shrub rose, is a hybrid rose species characterized by its ornamental foliage. It features broad, semi-evergreen leaves with striking variegation of white, yellow, and green patterns. The plant produces clusters of fragrant, semi-double pink flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It is often cultivated for its attractive appearance and is relatively low maintenance. This variety thrives in full sun to partial shade and prefers well-drained soil.
